summary: U.S. Customs and Border Protection provides security between ports of entry along the 4,000-mile-long border between the United States and Canada. However, CBP told us that staffing and resource challenges limit its enforcement activities along the U.S.-Canada border. For example, there are an insufficient number of agents for patrol missions. CBP has trouble addressing these challenges because of competing priorities along the U.S.-Mexico border. CBP...
title: Northern Border Security: CBP Identified Resource Challenges but Needs Performance Measures to Assess Security Between Ports of Entry
